	Strong financial analysis, reporting, and data interpretation skills.
	Excellent attention to detail, organizational, and communication skills.

Accountant (Preferably Female for Gender Balance) Job at SpringRock Group




        
    

        
        SpringRock Group is a privately held energy company with main focus in Oil and Gas and Power sectors of the energy domain. We straddle both aisles of the Oil and Gas industry as E&P Operator and Oilfield Service provider.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant (Preferably Female for Gender Balance)
Job Location: Lagos Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Accountant will be responsible for managing day-to-day financial operations, ensuring accuracy in all financial records, timely reporting, and compliance with accounting standards and company policies.
	The ideal candidate is analytical, proactive, and experienced in handling end-to-end accounting functions in a structured organization.


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly reconciliations for payment gateway providers.
	Record all bookkeeping entries and journal postings accurately.
	Generate weekly and monthly management cost and revenue reports.
	Reconcile general ledger accounts and resolve discrepancies.
	Process merchant, 3PL, vendor, and payroll payments.
	Handle refunds and chargebacks to buyers.
	Prepare financial reports (daily, weekly, monthly).
	Ensure remittances to statutory bodies (WHT, VAT, etc.) are done promptly.
	Support yearly audits and assist with inventory audits at hubs.
	Provide financial resolutions and support to merchants and buyers.
	Suggest improvements for accounting processes and efficiency.


Requirements and Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (Master’s degree is an advantage).
	7–8 years of relevant accounting or finance experience.
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACA, ACCA, or CFA) is required.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other Microsoft Office tools.
	Experience using accounting software (e.g., SAGE).
	Strong financial analysis, reporting, and data interpretation skills.
	Excellent attention to detail, organizational, and communication skills.


Method of Application

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Compliance Manager",
  "description": "ASA International is one of the world&#39;s largest international microfinance institutions providing socially responsible loans to low income entrepreneurs across Asia and Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Compliance Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Scope of the Role


	The Compliance Manager will be responsible for ensuring that all company operations comply with relevant financial regulations, industry standards, and internal policies.
	The role involves monitoring compliance risks, implementing compliance programs, and providing guidance to the organization on regulatory matters.


Specific Responsibilities


	Establish and maintain Compliance program to ensure the Company&rsquo;s compliance to applicable laws, regulations and guidelines.
